decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Planning and Heritage Statement; Design and Access Statement; Arboricultural Impact Assessment April 2021; Tree Data Schedule; Tree Constraints Plan TH/A3/2668/TCP; Foundation Design Statement; Site Location Plan 2021-002-LP; S100; 7760-1; Proposed Elevations and Sections_Amended_06.06.2021; Proposed Plans_Amended_06.06.2021; Street Scene Elevations_Amended_06.06.2021; Site Layouts_Amended_06.06.2021

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'Arboricultural Impact Assessment Method Statement & Tree Protection Plan (t BS:5837 2012)' reference 'TH 2668/C' dated '8th June 2021' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works. Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and 02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in the side elevations without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted (apart from the designated first floor terrace) shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 7 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 8 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:
   ii) The applicant was forthcoming with amended plans following officer request.
description: DEMOLITION OF EXISTING SINGLE STOREY SIDE AND REAR EXTENSION AND CAR PORT, AND ERECTION OF A NEW PART SINGLE PART TWO STOREY FRONT, SIDE AND REAR EXTENSION, INSTALLATION OF SIDE DORMER AND REPLACEMENT DORMERS TO REAR AND FRONT ELEVATIONS, CHANGES TO FENESTRATION, AND INSTALLATION OF RAISED SWIMMING POOL IN REAR GARDEN
